questions.question: Which CSS property is used to create a flex container?
What is the purpose of the 'z-index' property in CSS?
options: To control the transparency of an element
To control the stacking order of elements
To set the width of an element
questions.correctAnswer: To control the stacking order of elements

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to adhere to accessibility standards for navigation menus?
In React, what is the correct way to pass data from parent to child component?
Which JavaScript method is used to select an element by its ID?
What does semantic HTML mean?
options: Using HTML tags that convey meaning about the content
Using only div and span tags
questions.correctAnswer: Using HTML tags that convey meaning about the content

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid color value in CSS?
In JavaScript, what is the output of '2' + 2?
Which hook is used to manage side effects in functional React components?
What attribute is required on tags for accessibility?
Which CSS unit is relative to the font-size of the root element?
What is the default display value of a <div> element?
Which HTML5 element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
What does DOM stand for?
How do you declare a variable in JavaScript that cannot be reassigned?
Which React hook would you use to optimize performance by memoizing complex calculations?
What is the difference between specificy of ID selector vs Class selector?
How can you improve website performance regarding images?
options: Serve images in next-gen formats like WebP
Use CSS sprites for all images
questions.correctAnswer: Serve images in next-gen formats like WebP

questions.question: Which array method returns a new array with elements that pass a test?
What is 'prop drilling' in React?
options: Passing data deep down the component tree manually
questions.correctAnswer: Passing data deep down the component tree manually

questions.question: Which technique renders content only when it becomes visible in the viewport?
What does 'aria-live' attribute do?
options: Announces dynamic content updates to screen readers
questions.correctAnswer: Announces dynamic content updates to screen readers

questions.question: What is the 'Virtual DOM'?
options: A direct copy of the real DOM
A lightweight representation of the real DOM used by React
questions.correctAnswer: A lightweight representation of the real DOM used by React

questions.question: Which CSS feature allows you to define variables?
In JavaScript, what is the value of 'this' inside an arrow function?
options: The object that called the function
It is lexically scoped from the surrounding context
questions.correctAnswer: It is lexically scoped from the surrounding context

questions.question: Which HTTP status code indicates a successful request?
What is the purpose of 'useCallback' hook?
Which is a way to handle asynchronous operations in JavaScript?
What does the 'defer' attribute on a script tag do?
options: Executes the script after HTML parsing is complete
Loads the script in parallel but runs immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Executes the script after HTML parsing is complete

questions.question: What is the Box Model in CSS?
In Redux, what is the only way to change the state?
What is 'Event Bubbling'?
options: Event triggers on target then propagates up the DOM tree
Event triggers on root then propagates down
questions.correctAnswer: Event triggers on target then propagates up the DOM tree

questions.question: Which metatag is crucial for responsive design?
What is the purpose of Webpack?
Which status code represents 'Not Found'?
Explain the Concept of 'Closure' in JavaScript.
options: A function having access to its own scope only
A function having access to the parent scope, even after the parent function has closed
A variable that cannot be changed
questions.correctAnswer: A function having access to the parent scope, even after the parent function has closed

questions.question: What is the Critical Rendering Path?
options: The sequence of steps the browser takes to render the page
The path to the CSS file
questions.correctAnswer: The sequence of steps the browser takes to render the page

questions.question: How does React Fiber improve performance?
options: By determining which updates are more important (incremental rendering)
questions.correctAnswer: By determining which updates are more important (incremental rendering)

questions.question: What is the difference between 'localStorage' and 'sessionStorage'?
options: localStorage persists across sessions, sessionStorage clears when page session ends
localStorage is secure, sessionStorage is not
questions.correctAnswer: localStorage persists across sessions, sessionStorage clears when page session ends

questions.question: What is a 'Race Condition' in frontend development?
options: When async operations complete in an unexpected order, causing bugs
questions.correctAnswer: When async operations complete in an unexpected order, causing bugs

questions.question: Which WCAG compliance level is generally the legal standard?
What is 'Tree Shaking'?
options: Removing unused code during the build process
questions.correctAnswer: Removing unused code during the build process

questions.question: How do Service Workers enable PWA features?
options: By acting as a proxy between browser and network
questions.correctAnswer: By acting as a proxy between browser and network

questions.question: What is the main benefit of Server-Side Rendering (SSR)?
options: Better SEO and faster initial load
questions.correctAnswer: Better SEO and faster initial load

questions.question: What is 'Hydration' in the context of SSR?
options: Attaching event listeners to server-rendered HTML
questions.correctAnswer: Attaching event listeners to server-rendered HTML

questions.question: What does 'Layout Thrashing' refer to?
options: Forcing the browser to reflow the layout multiple times synchronously
questions.correctAnswer: Forcing the browser to reflow the layout multiple times synchronously

questions.question: Which HTTP header protects against Clickjacking?
Explain the 'Event Loop' in JavaScript.
options: It handles call stack, callback queue, and microtask queue execution
It loops through events in the DOM
It's a for loop for events
questions.correctAnswer: It handles call stack, callback queue, and microtask queue execution

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Content Security Policy' (CSP)?
options: To prevent XSS attacks by restricting resource sources
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent XSS attacks by restricting resource sources

questions.question: In CSS Grid, what does 'minmax()' do?
options: Sets a minimum and maximum size for a track
questions.correctAnswer: Sets a minimum and maximum size for a track
